announcement_body.headline: Dota 2 Short Film Contest 2025
body: For the last ten years, we've had the pleasure of watching a veritable parade of talented Dota fans pour their hearts into crafting short film tributes to the community and the game we all love. A select number of those creations even made grand debuts on the main stage of The International, broadcast to viewers around the world.

This year will be no different! In fact, we're happy to declare the [url=https://www.dota2.com/filmcontest]Dota 2 Short Film Contest[/url] officially open for a new round of submissions. Filmmakers will have until 3:00pm PDT on August 17th, 2025 to submit their short film creations of 90 seconds or less to the Dota 2 Steam Workshop to be eligible for consideration.

All Dota players are welcome to [url=https://steamcommunity.com/dota2shortfilm?snr=___]visit the Workshop[/url] to discuss, vote on their favorites, and help us select the best entries. The top ten finalists will be showcased as part of The International live broadcast. After reviewing the Workshop ratings and discussions, Valve will nominate the top entries to be featured in the Dota client for a final voting process by the community to determine the winners.

The top three selections will score prizes of $25,000, $10,000, and $5,000, and each of the other top ten finalists will win $500. (If you happened to miss the winners from last year, or just want to enjoy them again, the top three entries from 2024 were [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=p0qKpJXOJsY]At Any Cost[/url] by dmurio, [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=d8N2A8KePP4]Support [/url]by Nightfury Treann, and [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LJ6CoMgr2U8]The Sphere Master[/url] by Mikhail Pakhomov.)

Visit the [url=https://www.dota2.com/filmcontest]Dota 2 Short Film Contest site[/url] for more information and guidelines on the submission process. And be sure to stop by the Workshop page regularly to help review the submissions you would like to see showcased at The International, coming to you live from Hamburg in September.
